column1: únat (pl. únati) is a Quenya noun meaning "a thing impossible to be or to be done". The term refers to physical laws established by Ilúvatar that are impossible to break. The únati contrast with the axani
column2: which are laws established by Ilúvatar that lesser beings should not
column4: disobey. Melkor refused to accept any axani as binding upon him
column6: he was unable to violate the únati.

column1: The word consists of the prefix ú-
